word: After the rain ceased we pursued our journey. We were free from dust and everything in nature looked refreshed and smiling. We were upon a high elevation and the scenery in forests of dark green pine, intermingled with the bright and living green of the maple and ash upon the mountainsides, made a picture in nature that the penciling of artistic skill cannot possibly approach.--Ms 64, 1886, pp. 5. 6. ("Labors is Switzerland," No. 5, diary April 30 to May 23, 1886.)
